name: Mitigation Playbook for Command and Scripting Interpreter Incident
description: This playbook addresses a remote code execution attack through a vulnerability in the web application using parallel execution, conditional logic, and iterative steps.

parallel--abc12345-1234-5678-9101-123456.name: Execute Initial Mitigations
parallel--abc12345-1234-5678-9101-123456.description: Perform initial mitigation actions in parallel: kill malicious processes and patch vulnerabilities.

action--9c08ff0e-3236-4a35-ae4a-b9a00577.name: Kill Malicious Process
action--9c08ff0e-3236-4a35-ae4a-b9a00577.description: Terminate any processes associated with malicious scripts on the system.

action--f2a015eb-3895-471a-90d8-b521a46a.name: Patch Web Application Vulnerability
action--f2a015eb-3895-471a-90d8-b521a46a.description: Apply patch to fix the vulnerability in the web application.

action--d21bc5f4-47d7-42fb-b58d-87e3f598.name: Remove Unauthorized User Accounts
action--d21bc5f4-47d7-42fb-b58d-87e3f598.description: Delete unauthorized user accounts created by attackers.

commands.command: for user in $(cat bad_users.txt); do userdel -r $user; done

decision--ab12cd34-ef56-7890-abcd-ef1234.name: Check for Isolated Hosts
decision--ab12cd34-ef56-7890-abcd-ef1234.description: Determine if compromised hosts need to be isolated.

action--ba2ff9b6-f8a9-413f-9922-dc9a194f.name: Isolate Compromised Hosts
action--ba2ff9b6-f8a9-413f-9922-dc9a194f.description: Block all network traffic to and from compromised hosts.

loop--0e948d9b-c359-4806-a092-4158a8d48f.name: Perform Full System Scan
loop--0e948d9b-c359-4806-a092-4158a8d48f.description: Conduct a full system scan and remove infected files.

action--perform-scan.name: Scan System for Infected Files
action--perform-scan.description: Run system scan and remove detected infected files.

decision--a19da223-123e-432c-a567-abcd12.name: Check Patch Application Success
decision--a19da223-123e-432c-a567-abcd12.description: Verify if the patch to the web application was successful.

action--retry-patch.name: Retry Patching Web Application
action--retry-patch.description: Reattempt patching the web application if the previous attempt failed.
